title: Meet Your New Hero: Doggo Who Helped Take Down al-Baghdadi
text:
From Popular Mechanics

An incredible doggo has aided U.S. Navy SEALS in taking down the leader of ISIS, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

The dog, a Belgian Malinois whose name remains officially classified, suffered some injuries due to a suicide vest detonated by Baghdadi.

Some outlets are reporting that the pup's name is Conan—but nothing regarding its name has been officially announced.

A very good doggo has been hailed a hero after the canine chased down ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, leading to Baghdadi's demise.

The dog, whose name remains classified–although several outlets are reporting that its name is Conan—followed Baghdadi into a network of underground tunnels during a pursuit which resulted in Baghdadi setting off a suicide vest that killed him and three children he had taken with him.

The unnamed dog—a Belgian Malinois—sustained some injuries during its valiant effort to keep track of Baghdadi.

General Mark Milley, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, says that the Malinois, who is part of the Army Delta force, is recovering and is already back to work.

Because "the dog is still in theater," Milley added that its name would remain classified. However, President Trump tweeted a photo of the pup adding that it "did a GREAT JOB."

We have declassified a picture of the wonderful dog (name not declassified) that did such a GREAT JOB in capturing and killing the Leader of ISIS, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi! pic.twitter.com/PDMx9nZWvw — Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 28, 2019

The Washington Post shared that the dog is a male and is the same breed as Cairo, the dog who accompanied Navy SEALS during the 2011 Osama bin Laden raid. CNN reports that a government official said that because this was a Delta mission, details would be kept confidential. Even the identity of the doggo's handler will remain classified.

"The dog, the K-9, the military working dog, performed a tremendous service as they all do in a variety of situations," added General Milley during a news conference yesterday at the Pentagon. A New York Times reporter tweeted that the White House has invited the Malinois for a visit "whenever he can get over here."

DOG UPDATE: The dog who aided the ISIS raid has an invitation to the White House “whenever he can get over here,” per senior official. The president wants to meet him. — Katie Rogers (@katierogers) October 28, 2019

According to The Washington Post, Baghdadi was found in Syria’s Idlib province though why he was there remains unknown.

You Might Also Like
description: Actually, the Beglian Malinois does have a name, but it remains classified.
